meanings.sent1: She became waspish when her brother kept teasing her.
meanings.sent2: The waspish customer complained about every little detail.
meanings.sent3: Despite her waspish nature, she always had a smile for her friends.
meanings.sent4: Her waspish remarks stung like a bee, leaving others taken aback.
meanings.sent5: The waspish old cat hissed at anyone who came too close.

meanings.definition: Resembling a wasp in behavior or appearance
meanings.sent1: The way he buzzed around the room was quite waspish.
meanings.sent2: The insect's black and yellow stripes made it look waspish.
meanings.sent3: The waspish movements of the dancer added a unique flair to the performance.
meanings.sent4: Her waspish flight pattern through the garden was mesmerizing to watch.
meanings.sent5: The waspish behavior of the child made his parents chuckle.

meanings.definition: Sharp-tongued or snappish in speech or manner
meanings.sent1: Her waspish comments left everyone in the room silent.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's waspish tone made the students nervous.
meanings.sent3: Despite his waspish remarks, he was actually quite friendly.
meanings.sent4: The waspish retort stung harder than expected.
meanings.sent5: His waspish attitude made it hard for others to approach him.
